name: esb-csv-data
title: EAVS Section B CSV Data Standard

fields.name: Id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: Unique identifier for the transaction (i.e. not the voter). Ids should remain consistent, regardless of when an export is created.

fields.name: VoterId
fields.title: Voter Identifier
fields.description: Identifier that uniquely identifies a voter but is not required to be unique within the dataset. This number must be obfuscated from the original voter identifier in the jurisdiction's registration database. This field helps analyze how effective each type of transaction is for an individual voter.

fields.name: RequestMethod
fields.title: Request Method
fields.description: Specifies the method by which the request was triggered. Possible values are **email**; **fax**; **in-person**, which means the request was triggered by a person; **mail**; **online**, which means the request was submitted via online form or system â€” through the elections office or other registration agency; **phone**, which means the request was placed via phone call; **untracked**, which signifies that this variable is not tracked in the system; and, **other**, which is a catch-all for any values that fall outside of the other values.

fields.name: RequestOtherMethod
fields.title: Other Request Method
fields.description: If RequestMethod fails to cover all of the possible request methods for a particular voter transaction, this field specifies an alternate method by which the request was received.

fields.name: RequestDate
fields.title: Date of Request
fields.description: Specifies the date the request was processed by the local or state election official.

fields.name: RequestStatusType
fields.title: Request Status
fields.description: Specifies the current status of the request. Possible values are **accepted**, which denotes that the request was successfully processed; **cancelled**, which signifies that the request has been cancelled by a voter's direct or indirect action; **pending**, which signifies that request is still being processed; **rejected**, which means the request was not successfully processed.

fields.name: RequestStatusReasonType
fields.title: Request Status Reason Type
fields.description: If RequestStatusType is **rejected**, **cancelled**, or **pending**, then RequestStatusReasonType specifies the reason the activity was rejected. Possible values are **duplicate**, which denotes that the election official already received an application for the voter; **invalid**, which means the application was invalid; **mismatch-voter-signature**, which means the application signature did not match the voter signature on file; **missing-identification**, which means that an unspecified identifier was required and missing from the application; **missing-ssn**, denoting that the Social Security Number was missing from the application; **missing-state-id-number**, which means the state identifier was required and missing from the application; **missing-voter-signature**, meaning the voter did not sign the application; **untracked**, which means the reason for rejection is not tracked; and **other**, which is a catch-all for any values that fall outside of the other values. Multiple values are possible for this field.

fields.name: RequestReasonOtherType
fields.title: Other Request Reason Status Type
fields.description: If RequestStatusReasonType fails to cover all possible types of request reasons, this field will list an alternate type.

fields.name: RequestType
fields.title: Type of Request
fields.description: Specifies the type of request that triggered the change. Possible values are **fpca**, which means a voter submitted a Federal Postcard Application; **fwab**, which denotes a voter returned a Federal Write-In Absentee Ballot prior to receiving or requesting a ballot through other means; **informal-request**, which signifies a voter requested a ballot through a less formal process, such as a letter or phone call; **nvra**, which means a voter used a National Voter Registration (Act) form; **state-application**, which denotes a state form triggered the activity; and **untracked**, which means the type of application is not tracked.

fields.name: BallotRejectionType
fields.title: Ballot Rejection Type
fields.description: Specifies the reason why the ballot was rejected. Possible values are **mismatch-voter-signature**, which denotes the signature on file did not match the signature on the returned envelope or document; **missing-voter-signature**, which signifies that the voter signature is missing on the returned documents; **not-timely**, which means the ballot was received after the required deadline; **postmark**, which signifies the ballot was postmarked after the required date; **rejected**, which signifies the ballot was rejected for an unspecified reason; **undeliverable**, which denotes the ballot was returned as undeliverable to the address where it was sent; **untracked**, which signifies that this variable is not tracked in the system; **voided-spoiled**, which means the ballot had to be voided or spoiled either by the administration or the voter; **voter-died**, which signifies the voter died thereby impacting the ability to count the ballot (NB: this is largely dependent on state law); **voter-moved**, which signifies the voter moved from their registered address; **voter-unregistered**, which means the voter is not registered to vote; and, **other**, which is a catch-all for any values that fall outside of the other values.

fields.name: BallotRejectionOtherType
fields.title: Other Ballot Rejection Type
fields.description: If BallotRejectionType fails to cover all the possible ways a ballot may be rejected, this field specifies an alternate reason why the reason the ballot was rejected.

fields.name: BallotReceivedDate
fields.title: Ballot Received Date
fields.description: Specifies the date the ballot was received by the local or state election official.

fields.name: BallotReceivedMethod
fields.title: Ballot Received Method
fields.description: Specifies the method by which the ballot was received by the local or state election official. Possible values are **email**, which signifies the ballot was received via email; **fax**, which denotes the ballot was received by fax; **in-person**, which means the ballot was delivered by a person (NB: this does not necessarily signify the voter themselves delivered the ballot); **mail**, which signifies the ballot was received via mail; **online**, which means the ballot was submitted via online form or system; **untracked**, which signifies that this variable is not tracked in the system; and, **other**, which is a catch-all for any values that fall outside of the other values.

fields.name: BallotReceivedOtherMethod
fields.title: Other Ballot Received Method
fields.description: If BallotReceivedMethod fails to cover all of the possible return types for a particular voter transaction, this field specifies an alternate method by which the voter returned the ballot to the local or state election official.

fields.name: BallotTransmissionDate
fields.title: Ballot Transmission Date
fields.description: Specifies the date the local or state election official sent the ballot to the voter.

fields.name: BallotTransmissionMethod
fields.title: Ballot Transmission Method
fields.description: Specifies the method in which the ballot was sent to the voter. Possible values are **email**, which signifies the ballot was transmitted via email; **fax**, which denotes the ballot was transmitted by fax; **in-person**, which means the ballot given to a person; **mail**, which signifies the ballot was transmitted via mail; **online**, which means the ballot was transmitted via online form or system; **untracked**, which signifies that this variable is not tracked in the system; and, **other**, which is a catch-all for any values that fall outside of the other values.

fields.name: BallotTransmissionOtherMethod
fields.title: Other Ballot Transmission Method
fields.description: If BallotTransmissionMethod fails to cover all of the possible transmission types for a particular transaction, this field specifies an alternate method in which the local or state election official sent the ballot to the voter.

fields.name: BallotType
fields.title: Ballot Type
fields.description: Specifies the type of ballot transferred to the voter. Possible values are **absentee**, which is a general catch-all for any type of absentee ballot, **federal**, which denotes the voter only received a ballot that allows voting on federal contests, **full**, which denotes a ballot with all possible contests in the voter's assigned precinct; **fwab**, which specifies a Federal Write-In Absentee Ballot, and **provisional**, which denotes a provisional ballot; and, **untracked**, which signifies that this variable is not tracked in the system.

fields.name: ElectionDate
fields.title: Election Date
fields.description: Specifies the date the election took place.

fields.name: ElectionName
fields.title: Election Name
fields.description: Specifies the name of the election.

fields.name: JurisdictionId
fields.title: Jurisdiction Identifier
fields.description: Specifies a unique identifier for the jurisdiction.

fields.name: JurisdictionIdType
fields.title: Jurisdiction Identifier Type
fields.description: Specifies the type of identifier used to identify the jurisdiction in JurisdictionId. Possible values are **fips**, which means the identifier follows the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code, **local**, which dictates the jurisdiction created the identifier, or **ocd-id**, which means the identifier follows the Open Civic Data Division Identifier (OCDID) standard.

fields.name: JurisdictionName
fields.title: Jurisdiction Name
fields.description: Specifies the name of the jurisdiction in which the voter is registered.

fields.name: StateName
fields.title: State Name
fields.description: Specifies the name of the state in which the voter is registered.

fields.name: VoterMailingCountry
fields.title: Voter's Mailing Country
fields.description: Specifies what country to which the ballot was mailed. The country should be a recognized country name according to ISO 3166.

fields.name: VoterType
fields.title: Voter Type
fields.description: Specifies whether the voter is domestic or overseas military (or simply military if the designation is unknown), a spouse or dependent of a member of the military, or other if the type of voter falls outside the previous designations.
